remarks: Definition of a paracompact topology.  A topology is said to be paracompact iff every open cover has an open refinement that is locally finite.  The definition 6 of [BourbakiTop1] p.  I.69. also requires the topology to be Hausdorff, but this is dropped here.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 7-Jan-2020.)
statement: df-pcmp $p |- Paracomp = { j | j e. CovHasRef ( LocFin ` j ) } $.
